trans-unit.source: This article describes best practices for creating and displaying app settings.
trans-unit.target: This article describes best practices for creating and displaying app settings.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for app settings
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for app settings

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for app settings
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for app settings

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: App settings are the user-customizable portions of your app and live within an app settings page.
trans-unit.target: App settings are the user-customizable portions of your app and live within an app settings page.

trans-unit.source: For example, app settings in a news reader app might let the user specify which news sources to display or how many columns to display on the screen, while a weather app's settings could let the user choose between Celsius and Fahrenheit as the default unit of measurement.
trans-unit.target: For example, app settings in a news reader app might let the user specify which news sources to display or how many columns to display on the screen, while a weather app's settings could let the user choose between Celsius and Fahrenheit as the default unit of measurement.

trans-unit.source: This article describes best practices for creating and displaying app settings.
trans-unit.target: This article describes best practices for creating and displaying app settings.

trans-unit.source: example of a settings pane
trans-unit.target: example of a settings pane

trans-unit.source: Should I include a settings page in my app?
trans-unit.target: Should I include a settings page in my app?

trans-unit.source: Here are examples of app options that belong in an app settings page:
trans-unit.target: Here are examples of app options that belong in an app settings page:

trans-unit.source: Configuration options that affect the behavior of the app and don't require frequent readjustment, like choosing between Celsius or Fahrenheit as default units for temperature in a weather app, changing account settings for a mail app, settings for notifications, or accessibility options.
trans-unit.target: Configuration options that affect the behavior of the app and don't require frequent readjustment, like choosing between Celsius or Fahrenheit as default units for temperature in a weather app, changing account settings for a mail app, settings for notifications, or accessibility options.

trans-unit.source: Options that depend on the user's preferences, like music, sound effects, or color themes.
trans-unit.target: Options that depend on the user's preferences, like music, sound effects, or color themes.

trans-unit.source: App information that isn't accessed very often, such as privacy policy, help, app version, or copyright info.
trans-unit.target: App information that isn't accessed very often, such as privacy policy, help, app version, or copyright info.

trans-unit.source: Commands that are part of the typical app workflow (for example, changing the brush size in an art app) shouldn't be in a settings page.
trans-unit.target: Commands that are part of the typical app workflow (for example, changing the brush size in an art app) shouldn't be in a settings page.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about command placement, see [Command design basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958433).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about command placement, see [Command design basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn958433).

trans-unit.source: General recommendations
trans-unit.target: General recommendations

trans-unit.source: Keep settings pages simple and make use of binary (on/off) controls.
trans-unit.target: Keep settings pages simple and make use of binary (on/off) controls.

trans-unit.source: A [toggle switch](../controls-and-patterns/toggles.md) is usually the best control for a binary setting.
trans-unit.target: A [toggle switch](../controls-and-patterns/toggles.md) is usually the best control for a binary setting.

trans-unit.source: For settings that let users choose one item from a set of up to 5 mutually exclusive, related options, use [radio buttons](../controls-and-patterns/radio-button.md).
trans-unit.target: For settings that let users choose one item from a set of up to 5 mutually exclusive, related options, use [radio buttons](../controls-and-patterns/radio-button.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an entry point for all app settings in your app setting's page.
trans-unit.target: Create an entry point for all app settings in your app setting's page.

trans-unit.source: Keep your settings simple.
trans-unit.target: Keep your settings simple.

trans-unit.source: Define smart defaults and keep the number of settings to a minimum.
trans-unit.target: Define smart defaults and keep the number of settings to a minimum.

trans-unit.source: When a user changes a setting, the app should immediately reflect the change.
trans-unit.target: When a user changes a setting, the app should immediately reflect the change.

trans-unit.source: Don't include commands that are part of the common app workflow.
trans-unit.target: Don't include commands that are part of the common app workflow.

trans-unit.source: Entry point
trans-unit.target: Entry point

trans-unit.source: The way that users get to your app settings page should be based on your app's layout.
trans-unit.target: The way that users get to your app settings page should be based on your app's layout.

trans-unit.source: Navigation pane
trans-unit.target: Navigation pane

trans-unit.source: For a nav pane layout, app settings should be the last item in the list of navigational choices and be pinned to the bottom:
trans-unit.target: For a nav pane layout, app settings should be the last item in the list of navigational choices and be pinned to the bottom:

trans-unit.source: app settings entry point for nav pane
trans-unit.target: app settings entry point for nav pane

trans-unit.source: App bar
trans-unit.target: App bar

trans-unit.source: If you're using an app bar or tool bar, which is usually part of a hub or tabs/pivots navigational layout, place the entry point last item in the "More" flyout menu.
trans-unit.target: If you're using an app bar or tool bar, which is usually part of a hub or tabs/pivots navigational layout, place the entry point last item in the "More" flyout menu.

trans-unit.source: If greater discoverability for the settings entry point is important for your app, place the entry point directly on the app bar and not within the "More" flyout menu.
trans-unit.target: If greater discoverability for the settings entry point is important for your app, place the entry point directly on the app bar and not within the "More" flyout menu.

trans-unit.source: app settings entry point for app bar
trans-unit.target: app settings entry point for app bar

trans-unit.source: Hub
trans-unit.target: Hub

trans-unit.source: If you're using a hub layout, the entry point for app settings should be placed inside the "More" flyout menu of an app bar.
trans-unit.target: If you're using a hub layout, the entry point for app settings should be placed inside the "More" flyout menu of an app bar.

trans-unit.source: Tabs/pivots
trans-unit.target: Tabs/pivots

trans-unit.source: For a tabs or pivots layout, we don't recommended placing the app settings entry point as one of the top items within the navigation.
trans-unit.target: For a tabs or pivots layout, we don't recommended placing the app settings entry point as one of the top items within the navigation.

trans-unit.source: Instead, the entry point for app settings should be placed inside the "More" flyout menu of an app bar.
trans-unit.target: Instead, the entry point for app settings should be placed inside the "More" flyout menu of an app bar.

trans-unit.source: Master-details
trans-unit.target: Master-details

trans-unit.source: Instead of burying the app settings entry point deeply within a master-details pane, make it the last pinned item on the top level of the master pane.
trans-unit.target: Instead of burying the app settings entry point deeply within a master-details pane, make it the last pinned item on the top level of the master pane.

trans-unit.source: Layout
trans-unit.target: Layout

trans-unit.source: On both desktop and mobile, the app settings window should open full-screen and fill the whole window.
trans-unit.target: On both desktop and mobile, the app settings window should open full-screen and fill the whole window.

trans-unit.source: If your app settings menu has between up to four top-level groups, those groups should cascade down one column.
trans-unit.target: If your app settings menu has between up to four top-level groups, those groups should cascade down one column.

trans-unit.source: Desktop:
trans-unit.target: Desktop:

trans-unit.source: layout for app settings page on desktop
trans-unit.target: layout for app settings page on desktop

trans-unit.source: Mobile:
trans-unit.target: Mobile:

trans-unit.source: layout for app settings page on phone
trans-unit.target: layout for app settings page on phone

trans-unit.source: "About" section and "Give feedback" button
trans-unit.target: "About" section and "Give feedback" button

trans-unit.source: If you need an "About this app" section in your app, create a dedicated app settings page for that.
trans-unit.target: If you need an "About this app" section in your app, create a dedicated app settings page for that.

trans-unit.source: If you want a "Give Feedback" button, place that toward the bottom of the "About this app" page.
trans-unit.target: If you want a "Give Feedback" button, place that toward the bottom of the "About this app" page.

trans-unit.source: "Terms of Use" and "Privacy Statement" should be [hyperlink buttons](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md) with wrapping text.
trans-unit.target: "Terms of Use" and "Privacy Statement" should be [hyperlink buttons](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md) with wrapping text.

trans-unit.source: "about this app" section with "give feedback" button
trans-unit.target: "about this app" section with "give feedback" button

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: App settings page content
trans-unit.target: App settings page content

trans-unit.source: Once you have a list of items that you want to include in your app settings page, consider these guidelines:
trans-unit.target: Once you have a list of items that you want to include in your app settings page, consider these guidelines:

trans-unit.source: Group similar or related settings under one settings label.
trans-unit.target: Group similar or related settings under one settings label.

trans-unit.source: Try to keep the total number of settings to a maximum of four or five.
trans-unit.target: Try to keep the total number of settings to a maximum of four or five.

trans-unit.source: Display the same settings regardless of the app context.
trans-unit.target: Display the same settings regardless of the app context.

trans-unit.source: If some settings aren't relevant in a certain context, disable those in the app settings flyout.
trans-unit.target: If some settings aren't relevant in a certain context, disable those in the app settings flyout.

trans-unit.source: Use descriptive, one-word labels for settings.
trans-unit.target: Use descriptive, one-word labels for settings.

trans-unit.source: For example, name the setting "Accounts" instead of "Account settings" for account-related settings.
trans-unit.target: For example, name the setting "Accounts" instead of "Account settings" for account-related settings.

trans-unit.source: If you only want one option for your settings and the settings don't lend themselves to a descriptive label, use "Options" or "Defaults."
trans-unit.target: If you only want one option for your settings and the settings don't lend themselves to a descriptive label, use "Options" or "Defaults."

trans-unit.source: If a setting directly links to the web instead of to a flyout, let the user know this with a visual clue, such as "Help (online)" or "Web forums" styled as a [hyperlink](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md).
trans-unit.target: If a setting directly links to the web instead of to a flyout, let the user know this with a visual clue, such as "Help (online)" or "Web forums" styled as a [hyperlink](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md).

trans-unit.source: Consider grouping multiple links to the web into a flyout with a single setting.
trans-unit.target: Consider grouping multiple links to the web into a flyout with a single setting.

trans-unit.source: For example, an "About" setting could open a flyout with links to your terms of use, privacy policy, and app support.
trans-unit.target: For example, an "About" setting could open a flyout with links to your terms of use, privacy policy, and app support.

trans-unit.source: Combine less-used settings into a single entry so that more common settings can each have their own entry.
trans-unit.target: Combine less-used settings into a single entry so that more common settings can each have their own entry.

trans-unit.source: Put content or links that only contain information in an "About" setting.
trans-unit.target: Put content or links that only contain information in an "About" setting.

trans-unit.source: Don't duplicate the functionality in the "Permissions" pane.
trans-unit.target: Don't duplicate the functionality in the "Permissions" pane.

trans-unit.source: Windows provides this pane by default and you can't modify it.
trans-unit.target: Windows provides this pane by default and you can't modify it.

trans-unit.source: Add settings content to Settings flyouts
trans-unit.target: Add settings content to Settings flyouts

trans-unit.source: Present content from top to bottom in a single column, scrollable if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Present content from top to bottom in a single column, scrollable if necessary.

trans-unit.source: Limit scrolling to a maximum of twice the screen height.
trans-unit.target: Limit scrolling to a maximum of twice the screen height.

trans-unit.source: Use the following controls for app settings:
trans-unit.target: Use the following controls for app settings:

trans-unit.source: [Toggle switches](../controls-and-patterns/toggles.md): To let users set values on or off.
trans-unit.target: [Toggle switches](../controls-and-patterns/toggles.md): To let users set values on or off.

trans-unit.source: [Radio buttons](../controls-and-patterns/radio-button.md): To let users choose one item from a set of up to 5 mutually exclusive, related options.
trans-unit.target: [Radio buttons](../controls-and-patterns/radio-button.md): To let users choose one item from a set of up to 5 mutually exclusive, related options.

trans-unit.source: [Text input box](../controls-and-patterns/text-block.md): To let users enter text.
trans-unit.target: [Text input box](../controls-and-patterns/text-block.md): To let users enter text.

trans-unit.source: Use the type of text input box that corresponds to the type of text you're getting from the user, such as an email or password.
trans-unit.target: Use the type of text input box that corresponds to the type of text you're getting from the user, such as an email or password.

trans-unit.source: [Hyperlinks](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md): To take the user to another page within the app or to an external website.
trans-unit.target: [Hyperlinks](../controls-and-patterns/hyperlinks.md): To take the user to another page within the app or to an external website.

trans-unit.source: When a user clicks a hyperlink, the Settings flyout will be dismissed.
trans-unit.target: When a user clicks a hyperlink, the Settings flyout will be dismissed.

trans-unit.source: [Buttons](../controls-and-patterns/buttons.md): To let users initiate an immediate action without dismissing the current Settings flyout.
trans-unit.target: [Buttons](../controls-and-patterns/buttons.md): To let users initiate an immediate action without dismissing the current Settings flyout.

trans-unit.source: Add a descriptive message if one of the controls is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Add a descriptive message if one of the controls is disabled.

trans-unit.source: Place this message above the disabled control.
trans-unit.target: Place this message above the disabled control.

trans-unit.source: Animate content and controls as a single block after the Settings flyout and header have animated.
trans-unit.target: Animate content and controls as a single block after the Settings flyout and header have animated.

trans-unit.source: Animate content using the [**enterPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212672) or [**EntranceThemeTransition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210288) animations with a 100px left offset.
trans-unit.target: Animate content using the [**enterPage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br212672) or [**EntranceThemeTransition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br210288) animations with a 100px left offset.

trans-unit.source: Use section headers, paragraphs, and labels to aid organize and clarify content, if necessary.
trans-unit.target: Use section headers, paragraphs, and labels to aid organize and clarify content, if necessary.

trans-unit.source: If you need to repeat settings, use an additional level of UI or an expand/collapse model, but avoid hierarchies deeper than two levels.
trans-unit.target: If you need to repeat settings, use an additional level of UI or an expand/collapse model, but avoid hierarchies deeper than two levels.

trans-unit.source: For example, a weather app that provides per-city settings could list the cities and let the user tap on the city to either open a new flyout or expand to show the settings options.
trans-unit.target: For example, a weather app that provides per-city settings could list the cities and let the user tap on the city to either open a new flyout or expand to show the settings options.

trans-unit.source: If loading controls or web content takes time, use an indeterminate progress control to indicate to users that info is loading.
trans-unit.target: If loading controls or web content takes time, use an indeterminate progress control to indicate to users that info is loading.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Guidelines for progress controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465469).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Guidelines for progress controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465469).

trans-unit.source: Don't use buttons for navigation or to commit changes.
trans-unit.target: Don't use buttons for navigation or to commit changes.

trans-unit.source: Use hyperlinks to navigate to other pages, and instead of using a button to commit changes, automatically save changes to app settings when a user dismisses the Settings flyout.
trans-unit.target: Use hyperlinks to navigate to other pages, and instead of using a button to commit changes, automatically save changes to app settings when a user dismisses the Settings flyout.

trans-unit.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows�10.
